fullText: Though the show is beautifully acted and staged, it feels more like a gentle memorial service than a fully realized theatrical experience.
dtliExcerpt: Though the show is beautifully acted and staged, it feels more like a gentle memorial service than a fully realized theatrical experience.
showScoreExcerpt: Though the show is beautifully acted and staged, it feels more like a gentle memorial service than a fully realized theatrical experience.
nycTheatreExcerpt: "The play needs to take the audience by the hand and lead it to and through the most nightmarish depths of Delia's illness, when she is in the hospital, begging to die. Instead it abruptly drops us there and expects us to switch from comedy mode to drama."
